pullRequest.body:
`Mathlib.RingTheory.Nilpotent` has a few very simple definitions (`Mathlib.Data.Nat.Lattice` is sufficient to state them), but needs some pretty heavy imports (ideals, linear algebra) towards the end. This change moves the heavier parts into a new file.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

- [x] depends on: #12090

I have no strong feelings where the split goes, exactly. We could also keep

* `Prime.isRadical` (`Mathlib.Algebra.Associated`)
* `Commute.isNilpotent_{add,sum,sub}` (`Mathlib.Data.Nat.Choose.Sum`)
* `isNilpotent_mul_{left,right}_iff` (`Mathlib.Algebra.GroupWithZero.NonZeroDivisors`)

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

bors d+

This file should be fixed by:
```suggestion
import Mathlib.LinearAlgebra.Quotient
import Mathlib.LinearAlgebra.StdBasis
```

With this set of imports, it might arguably even make sense to move this file to `Algebra.GroupWithZero`. I'll leave that to your judgement though: it also makes sense to keep all the files on nilpotent elements together in one folder.
I have no strong feeling on this.

My hobby: sorting imports!
```suggestion
import Mathlib.LinearAlgebra.Matrix.ToLin
import Mathlib.LinearAlgebra.Quotient
import Mathlib.RingTheory.Nilpotent.Basic
```

(Can't put a comment down there but:) The module doc lists the main results, a lot of which got moved. I think it's more natural to keep those easily accessible in a light-weight file.

Perhaps it would be an option to split into the following three files:
 * definition of Nilpotent (minimal imports)
 * basic results of Nilpotent on rings (shows that nilpotent elements are closed under all the operations: the current contents of the `Lemmas.lean` file up to, but excluding, definition of `nilradical`?)
 * extra results that need the full complement of imports.
I ended up making `Defs` with "everything that worked with just `Mathlib.Data.Nat.Lattice`". I'm not sure that leaves us with a super clear split; happy for concrete suggestions :)
I agree that this split is not the cleanest. But after playing around for a while I couldn't figure out a real improvement. So I think the three-way split is the way to go.

**[imports]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion import Mathlib.RingTheory.Nilpotent.Defs import Mathlib.RingTheory.Noetherian ```

Let's extend the docstring slightly:

```suggestion
# Nilpotent elements

This file develops the basic theory of nilpotent elements. In particular it shows that the nilpotent elements are closed under many operations.

For the definition of `nilradical`, see `Mathlib.RingTheory.Nilpotent.Lemmas`.

```

```suggestion
# Definition of nilpotent elements

This file defines the notion of a nilpotent element and proves the immediate consequences.
For results that require further theory, see `Mathlib.RingTheory.Nilpotent.Basic`
and `Mathlib.RingTheory.Nilpotent.Lemmas`.
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore: split RingTheory.Nilpotent
